column1: The Association of Independent Beverage Distributors (""AIBD""), a subsidiary of the Coca-Cola Bottlers' Association (""CCBA""), is focused on extending benefit programs designed for the Coca-Cola bottlers to the MillerCoors Distributors.

Further savings will be gained as more members, both MillerCoors Distributors and Coke bottlers, join the program thus increasing the group's buying power and reducing administrative costs.

Life and Disability programs are fully insured programs offered at group buying rates through Hartford and/or Mutual of Omaha and are available to all MillerCoors Distributors whether or not you participate in the Medical program.

column1: Protect yourself from spikes in fuel costs by utilizing the fuel hedging program offered to Network Services Distributors by the Coca-Cola Bottler's Association (???CCBA???). This program allows Network Services Distributors, through DSI, to participate in the existing fuel hedging program for Coca-Cola bottlers.

As you know, changes in market (pump) prices of fuel are driven by global market forces and can be effected with limited time lag. Any fuel user can participate in the futures market and lock in and protect their fuel cost subject to trading minimums of 42,000 gallons a month per call option. However, CCBA has designed this program to accommodate smaller call option contracts ??? allowing you to purchase contracts directly from CCBA in 1,000 gallon increments. Please note you do not take possession of fuel through this program ??? this works like insurance. You have a contract that if fuel goes above a certain level, you will receive a monetary settlement.
Click here for answers to your Frequently Asked Questions regarding the fuel hedging program as well as an example of how a call option can protect your price of fuel.
• Budget accurately for fuel for the year ahead
The process to participate in the CCBA fuel hedging program is as follows:

• Attend the next scheduled informational conference call on Wednesday, April 6 at 3pm EST. Contact Anne Drolet at 303-277-3247 or adrolet@dsi-mail.com to register for this call. (Participation on this call does not create any obligations.)
• Contact Anne Drolet with any general questions or for more information on options, market conditions, and pricing.
• Complete the CCBA Credit Application. Once you've completed this form, fax or email it to Anne Drolet at 303-277-2463 or adrolet@dsi-mail.com.
• Anne Drolet will contact you once your application has been approved.

• To partake in the program, contact Ann Burton, CFO of CCBA, at 678-539-2302 or aburton@ccbanet.com to discuss the current pricing, quantity and timeframe of the diesel/unleaded gasoline you want to hedge. Quantities need to be in 1,000 gallon increments.
• The contracts will then be bought and distributors will be invoiced immediately (payment for the contracts is due upon invoice receipt).

• At the end of each month, the average diesel (CME Group New York Harbor Heating Oil Price) and unleaded gasoline (CME Group RBOB Gasoline) is published and within 10 days, settlement will be made between CCBA and each Network Services Distributor.

Life and Disability programs are fully insured programs offered at group buying rates through Hartford and/or Mutual of Omaha and are available to all Johns Manville Pinnacle and Summit Contractors whether or not you participate in the Medical program.

StormSource Software, Inc has been supplying software since 2001 and their first web-based product, Appointment-Plus, is an industry leader in online appointment scheduling software, utilized by many of your MillerCoors Distributor peers. StormSource offers Appointment-Plus to MillerCoors Distributors at an attractive price to help you efficiently schedule supplier deliveries, expedite receiving, turnover carrier equipment quicker and cut down on driver wait time.

Appointment-Plus Scheduling Software is a web based tool designed to make scheduling appointments at your distribution center more efficient. It allows delivery truck drivers and dispatchers to schedule their own delivery appointments at your location through an online tool, as opposed to one of your employees manually scheduling and rescheduling deliveries. Scheduling deliveries online can reduce congestion at your distribution center by ensuring that only a set number of deliveries arrive at once, while also giving your managers more control over their deliveries.
